etymology.description: Pictogram: 虍 represents the tiger’s head; the torso disappeared; the legs and tail became 人 in small seal, later 儿 in clerical.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a tiger’s head with simplified limbs, reduced through script evolution. The body was dropped, leaving the head element (虍) and the legs/tail streamlined to 儿.

examples.chinese: 老虎在山林里咆哮(老虎在山林裡咆哮)。
examples.english: The tiger roars in the forest.

examples.chinese: 中国人常说“如虎添翼”(中國人常說「如虎添翼」)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó rén cháng shuō “rú hǔ tiān yì”.
examples.english: Chinese people often say “like adding wings to a tiger,” meaning to greatly strengthen something.

examples.chinese: 他属虎，今年运势不错(他屬虎，今年運勢不錯)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shǔ hǔ, jīnnián yùnshì búcuò.
examples.english: He was born in the Year of the Tiger, and his fortune is good this year.
